»Pe***, gej, fe***,« je slišal fant udeleženca šova Bar! Potem se je začelo
Homofobni napad  še preiskujejo.
02 Nov 2019, 20:03 by Oste Bakal oste.bakal@slovenskenovice.si



Rene Žunič ima hudo poškodovano ledvico. FOTO: osebni arhiv



Nejc Rek je zgrožen zaradi napada na njegovega partnerja. FOTO: Facebook



V mestnem parku v zadnjih mesecih opažajo več nasilja FOTO: Oste Bakal


MURSKA SOBOTA – Medtem ko so se 12 dni po brutalnem napadu na Reneja Žuniča v UKC Maribor zdravniki še vedno borili za njegovo ledvico, smo se pogovarjali z napadenim LGBT-aktivistom. Več kot očitno je, da je bila razlog za nasilje homofobija. »Z Nejcem sva bila povabljena na večerjo k moji sestri. Zatem sva se s prijateljem odločila, da greva v Mladinski informativni in kulturni klub (MIKK) Murska Sobota, kjer je bil večer glasbe devetdesetih let. Ves večer je bilo vse tako, kot mora biti.Pravzaprav sem tam domač, vsi me poznajo. Zadnje, česar se spomnim, je to, da sem šel do natakarice in jo vprašal, ali bi se mi pridružila na cigareti. Zaradi dela je vabilo odklonila, nato pa se je začelo. Jaz sem nato pograbil jakno in šel po stopnicah ven, se obrnil na desno in od zadaj je priletel udarec. Poleg tega pa še besede 'peder, gej, feget.' Od takrat naprej se ne spomnim nič več. Te besede je govorila samo ena oseba, toda slišal sem več glasov. Naslednje, česar se spomnim, je to, da so me dajali v rešilca,« nam je Rene v bolnišnici opisal dogodke tistega petkovega večera.
Tistemu, ki je to storil, sporočam, da ga bomo slej kot prej našli in bo odgovarjal za škodo, ki jo naredil mojemu partnerju,« pravi Nejc Rek.
V bolnišnici, še pod vplivom protibolečinskih substanc, je govoril s policisti in jim razložil tisto, kar je vedel. »Policista sta prišla k meni na oddelek, toda takrat sem bil pod vplivom velikega števila substanc proti bolečinam. Zato se niti ne spomnim, kaj vse smo se pogovarjali. To se mi ne zdi najbolj dobro. Za njima je prišel še kriminalist in dejal, da je vse skupaj zelo sumljivo, ker nihče ni videl ali slišal ničesar. Tudi jaz se ne spomnim, kako sem prišel do stanovanja oziroma do našega dvorišča,« je dejal.
Vse življenje bo nosil posledice
Poročali smo že, da je nad napadom v Murski Soboti ogorčen tudi njegov partner Nejc Rek, mnogim znan iz resničnostnega šova Bar in kot borec za pravice LGBT. Rene ima namreč poleg polomljenih reber hudo poškodovano ledvico, kot je povedal Nejc, menda nikoli več ne bo delovala stoodstotno. Tudi če jo obdrži, bo menda delovala okrnjeno, le okrog 60-odstotno. »Reči moram, da je sramota, da se to dogaja v naši državi, natančneje v Murski Soboti. Da pa ni nihče ničesar videl in ne slišal? Ne verjamem, da ni bilo takrat blizu nikogar, ki bi dogodek videl! Tistemu, ki je to storil, sporočam, da ga bomo slej kot prej našli in bo odgovarjal za škodo, ki jo je naredil mojemu partnerju. Dejansko je šlo za poskus umora, saj so Reneju zadali hude telesne poškodbe, zaradi katerih bo imel vse življenje posledice! Nikakor ne bomo pustili, da krivci ostanejo nekaznovani, gremo do konca, proti homofobiji, da dosežemo, da bodo storilci dobili svoje!« je odločno dejal Nejc.


Nejc Rek je zgrožen zaradi napada na njegovega partnerja. FOTO: Facebook

Tudi v MIKK Murska Sobota pozivajo pristojne institucije, da se še aktivneje vključijo v reševanje problematike nasilja v mestnem parku, kjer v zadnjih mesecih opažajo več nasilja. Poudarili so, da so več kot dve desetletji prostor vključevanja, povezovanja, strpnosti in da nameravajo to ostati tudi v prihodnosti. »Obsojamo vsakršno razpihovanje nestrpnosti na podlagi rase, narodnosti, političnega prepričanja in spolne usmerjenosti. MIKK Murska Sobota ima ničelno stopnjo stopnjo tolerance do vseh vrst in oblik nasilja. Pozivamo vse pristojne institucije, da se še aktivneje vključijo v reševanje vedno večje problematike nasilja v mestnem parku v Murski Soboti,« so v zapisali v sporočilu za javnost.Na Policijski upravi Murska Sobota o dogodku sicer še molčijo, saj zadevo preiskujejo in bodo po končanih aktivnostih o ugotovitvah obvestili javnost.
text:
"Pe ***, gay, fe ***," the boy in the Bar Show heard! Then it started
Homophobic attack is still under investigation.
02 Nov 2019, 20:03 by Oste Bakal oste.bakal@slovenskenovice.si



Rene Zunic has severely injured kidney. PHOTO: Personal Archive



Nejc Rek is appalled at the attack on his partner. PHOTO: Facebook



More violence in town park in recent months PHOTO: Oste Bakal


MURDAY SATURDAY - While doctors were still fighting for his kidney 12 days after the brutal attack on Renej Zunic at UCC Maribor, we spoke with the attacked LGBT activist. It is more than obvious that the reason for the violence was homophobia. “Nejac and I were invited to dinner with my sister. Then my friend and I decided to go to the Murska Sobota Youth Information and Cultural Club (MIKK), where the evening of music was in the 1990s. The whole evening was just the way it should be. In fact, I'm home there, everyone knows me. The last thing I remember is going to the waitress and asking her if she would join me for a cigarette. Because of work, she declined the invitation, and then it began. I then grabbed my jacket and went up the stairs, turned to the right, and a kick came from behind. In addition, the words 'gay, gay, feget.' From then on, I remember nothing more. Only one person spoke these words, but I heard multiple voices. The next thing I remember is that they put me in an ambulance, ”Rene told us at the hospital about the events of that Friday night.
I tell the one who did this that later we would find him and he would be responsible for the damage he did to my partner, "says Nejc Rek.
At the hospital, still under the influence of painkillers, he spoke with police officers and explained to them what he knew. “The police came to my department, but at that time I was under the influence of a lot of painkillers. So I don't even remember what we were talking about. That doesn't seem to me the best. A criminalist came behind them and said that everything was very suspicious because no one saw or heard anything. I also don't remember how I got to the apartment or our yard, "he said.
He will carry consequences all his life
We have already reported that his partner Nejc Rek, known to many from the reality show Bar and as a fighter for LGBT rights, is also outraged over the attack in Murska Sobota. Rene has a badly damaged kidney in addition to broken ribs, as Nejc said, it will never work 100% again. Even if it is retained, it will appear to be downsized, only around 60%. “I have to say that it is a shame that this is happening in our country, more precisely in Murska Sobota. That no one saw or heard anything? I don't think there was anyone close to seeing the event at the time! I tell the one who did this that we will find him later and he will be responsible for the damage he has done to my partner. In fact, it was an attempted murder, as Renee was seriously injured and will have life-threatening consequences! We will by no means let the culprits go unpunished, we will go to the end, towards homophobia, to get the perpetrators to get theirs! ”Said Nejc firmly.


Nejc Rek is appalled at the attack on his partner. PHOTO: Facebook

Murska Sobota also calls on the competent institutions to become more involved in solving the problem of violence in the city park, where more violence has been observed in recent months. They stressed that they have been a place of inclusion, networking, tolerance for more than two decades and that they intend to continue to do so in the future. “We condemn any outburst of intolerance on the basis of race, nationality, political conviction and sexual orientation. MIKK Murska Sobota has a zero tolerance rate for all types and forms of violence. We urge all relevant institutions to become more actively involved in solving the growing problem of violence in Murska Sobota City Park, "they wrote in a press release.The Murska Sobota Police Department is still silent about the incident, as the matter is being investigated and will be closed the findings were reported to the public.
